tasks.title: Project Structure and Environment Setup
tasks.description: Set up a scalable and maintainable project structure with all required libraries and development environment configuration.
tasks.details:
1. Create project folder structure following the PRD guidelines:
   - src/components/ for UI components
   - src/core/ for core viewer functionality
   - src/tools/ for tool-related functionality
   - src/utils/ for utility functions
   - src/config/ for configuration files
   - src/types/ for TypeScript type definitions
   - public/ for static assets
   - dist/ for build output
   - examples/ for usage examples

2. Install required dependencies:
```bash
npm init -y
npm install --save @cornerstonejs/core @cornerstonejs/tools @cornerstonejs/dicom-image-loader @cornerstonejs/nifti-volume-loader @cornerstonejs/streaming-image-volume-loader dicom-parser dcmjs
npm install --save-dev typescript webpack webpack-cli webpack-dev-server ts-loader html-webpack-plugin css-loader style-loader
```

3. Configure TypeScript and Webpack:
   - Create tsconfig.json for TypeScript configuration
   - Set up webpack.config.js for bundling
   - Configure development server

4. Create basic HTML template with viewport containers

5. Set up initial application entry point (src/index.ts) with Cornerstone3D initialization
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify all dependencies install correctly without conflicts
2. Ensure webpack builds successfully without errors
3. Confirm development server starts and serves the application
4. Validate TypeScript compilation works correctly
5. Check that the basic HTML template renders properly

subtasks.title: Define and Create the Folder Structure
subtasks.description: Establish the foundational directory layout for the project, including folders for source code, configuration, and build outputs.
subtasks.details: Create the main project directory. Inside it, add a 'src' folder for TypeScript/JavaScript files and any other necessary folders (e.g., 'dist' for build output).

subtasks.title: Initialize npm and Install Dependencies
subtasks.description: Set up npm in the project directory and install required packages such as TypeScript and other development dependencies.
subtasks.details: Run 'npm init' to generate package.json. Install TypeScript and any other needed packages (e.g., ts-node-dev, webpack, webpack-dev-server) as dev dependencies.

subtasks.title: Configure TypeScript
subtasks.description: Initialize and customize the TypeScript configuration for the project.
subtasks.details: Run 'npx tsc --init' to create tsconfig.json. Adjust compiler options as needed for the project's requirements.

subtasks.title: Configure Webpack and Dev Server
subtasks.description: Set up Webpack for bundling and configure the development server for live reloading and efficient development.
subtasks.details: Create webpack.config.js with entry/output settings, loaders for TypeScript, and dev server configuration. Ensure compatibility with TypeScript setup.

subtasks.title: Create the Base HTML Template
subtasks.description: Develop the initial HTML file that will serve as the application's entry point in the browser.
subtasks.details: Add an index.html file in the project root or public folder. Include a script tag referencing the bundled JavaScript output.

subtasks.title: Implement Application Entry Point and Verify Initial Build
subtasks.description: Create the main TypeScript entry file and confirm that the build process produces the expected output.
subtasks.details: Add an index.ts or main.ts in 'src'. Implement a simple log or UI element. Run the build and dev server to verify everything compiles and displays correctly.

tasks.title: Basic Viewport and Rendering Engine Implementation
tasks.description: Implement core functionality to display DICOM images with proper rendering engine setup and image loading capabilities.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test viewport initialization with various container sizes
2. Verify rendering engine properly initializes and connects to viewports
3. Test DICOM image loading with sample images
4. Validate image display functionality with different image types
5. Check for memory leaks during repeated image loading/unloading

subtasks.title: Implement Viewport Initialization
subtasks.description: Set up the initial viewport area in the application where DICOM images will be displayed.
subtasks.details: Define the HTML/CSS structure for the viewer container. Ensure the viewport is responsive and can accommodate different image sizes.

subtasks.title: Set Up the Rendering Engine
subtasks.description: Integrate and configure the rendering engine that will handle DICOM image display within the viewport.
subtasks.details: Choose a suitable rendering library (e.g., Cornerstone, OHIF). Initialize the rendering context and link it to the viewport element.

subtasks.title: Configure DICOM Image Loader
subtasks.description: Set up the module responsible for loading and parsing DICOM images from local files or remote sources.
subtasks.details: Integrate a DICOM loader library. Configure it to support both file uploads and network retrieval (e.g., DICOMweb, PACS).

subtasks.title: Implement Image Loading Logic
subtasks.description: Develop the logic to handle asynchronous loading, parsing, and error handling for DICOM images.
subtasks.details: Write functions to manage image selection, loading progress, and error states. Ensure support for multiple image series and slices.

subtasks.title: Create the Basic Viewer Component
subtasks.description: Build the main viewer component that integrates the viewport, rendering engine, and image loader.
subtasks.details: Develop a reusable component/class that manages state, user interactions (zoom, pan, scroll), and rendering updates.

subtasks.title: Integrate All Modules in an Initialization Script
subtasks.description: Write an initialization script that ties together the viewport, rendering engine, image loader, and viewer component.
subtasks.details: Ensure all modules are properly instantiated and configured. Set up event listeners and application startup logic.

subtasks.title: Validate with Sample Images and Error Handling
subtasks.description: Test the complete viewer with sample DICOM images and implement robust error handling for edge cases.
subtasks.details: Load various DICOM files to verify rendering accuracy and performance. Simulate errors (e.g., corrupt files, network issues) and confirm graceful handling.

tasks.title: Volume Rendering Implementation
tasks.description: Implement 3D volume rendering capabilities including volume loading, 3D viewport configuration, and Multi-Planar Reconstruction (MPR).
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test volume loading with different DICOM series
2. Verify 3D rendering with various volume types
3. Test MPR functionality with axial, sagittal, and coronal planes
4. Validate volume property adjustments (window/level, opacity)
5. Test performance with large volumes
6. Verify correct orientation and alignment in MPR views

subtasks.title: Implement Volume Loader
subtasks.description: Develop a module to load volumetric data from various formats (e.g., DICOM, NIfTI) into memory for further processing and visualization.
subtasks.details: Ensure support for multiple medical imaging formats and efficient memory management for large datasets.

subtasks.title: Register and Configure Volume Loaders
subtasks.description: Create a system to register different volume loader implementations and configure them based on data type or user preferences.
subtasks.details: Allow dynamic selection and configuration of loaders to handle diverse data sources and formats.

subtasks.title: Implement 3D Viewport Creation
subtasks.description: Develop the core 3D viewport component for displaying volumetric data, supporting real-time interaction and navigation.
subtasks.details: Integrate with rendering engine and ensure compatibility with loaded volume data.

subtasks.title: Set Up Volume Rendering Options
subtasks.description: Add configurable rendering options such as transfer functions, lighting models, and rendering algorithms (e.g., ray casting, texture mapping).
subtasks.details: Expose controls for color/opacity mapping and lighting to enhance visualization of internal structures.

subtasks.title: Implement MPR Viewports
subtasks.description: Develop Multi-Planar Reconstruction (MPR) viewports to display orthogonal slices (axial, sagittal, coronal) of the volume data.
subtasks.details: Ensure accurate slice extraction and interactive navigation through the volume.

subtasks.title: Integrate MPR with Volume Data
subtasks.description: Connect MPR viewports with the loaded volume data, ensuring correct orientation and synchronization with the 3D viewport.
subtasks.details: Handle coordinate transformations and update mechanisms for consistent data representation.

subtasks.title: Create Volume Controller for Property Adjustments
subtasks.description: Implement a controller UI to adjust volume rendering properties such as window/level, opacity, and color mapping in real time.
subtasks.details: Provide intuitive controls for users to fine-tune visualization parameters and immediately see results.

subtasks.title: Test with Multiple Volume Types and Orientations
subtasks.description: Validate the system using various volume datasets and orientations to ensure robust performance and correct visualization.
subtasks.details: Include edge cases such as non-standard orientations and large datasets to assess stability and rendering quality.

tasks.title: Measurement Tools Implementation
tasks.description: Implement various measurement tools including length, angle, and area measurements with result management capabilities.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test each measurement tool individually with mouse interactions
2. Verify measurement accuracy against known dimensions
3. Test measurement persistence and retrieval
4. Validate measurement event handling
5. Test measurement tools on different image types (2D, 3D, MPR)
6. Verify measurement display formatting and units

subtasks.title: Set Up Measurement Tools Infrastructure
subtasks.description: Establish the foundational architecture and dependencies required for all measurement tools, including UI scaffolding, event listeners, and data models.
subtasks.details: Define core interfaces, set up base classes for measurement tools, and ensure extensibility for future measurement types.

subtasks.title: Implement Length Measurement Tool
subtasks.description: Develop the tool for measuring linear distances, including UI interactions for selecting start and end points and displaying real-time feedback.
subtasks.details: Handle mouse/touch events, draw lines, and calculate/display length values accurately on 2D/3D images.

subtasks.title: Implement Angle Measurement Tool
subtasks.description: Create the tool for measuring angles, supporting user selection of three points and providing visual and numeric feedback.
subtasks.details: Enable interactive angle creation, display angle arcs, and ensure precise calculation and rendering.

subtasks.title: Implement Area Measurement Tools (Elliptical/Rectangle)
subtasks.description: Develop tools for measuring areas using elliptical and rectangular shapes, supporting user-driven shape creation and area calculation.
subtasks.details: Allow users to draw and adjust ellipses/rectangles, calculate area in real time, and display results on the image.

subtasks.title: Create Measurement Manager
subtasks.description: Build a central manager to coordinate measurement tool activation, state management, and communication between tools and the UI.
subtasks.details: Implement logic for switching tools, managing active measurements, and providing a unified API for measurement operations.

subtasks.title: Integrate Event Handling for Measurements
subtasks.description: Implement robust event handling to support precise user interactions, feedback, and error handling across all measurement tools.
subtasks.details: Ensure consistent event propagation, handle edge cases (e.g., overlapping measurements), and provide visual cues for user actions.

subtasks.title: Implement Persistence and Retrieval of Measurements
subtasks.description: Enable saving, loading, and restoring measurement data, ensuring measurements persist across sessions and can be retrieved as needed.
subtasks.details: Design data serialization formats, integrate with storage solutions, and provide UI for managing saved measurements.

tasks.title: Annotation System Implementation
tasks.description: Implement a comprehensive annotation system including text annotations, arrow annotations, and annotation styling capabilities.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test text annotation creation and positioning
2. Verify arrow annotation drawing and text association
3. Test annotation styling with different colors, fonts, and line widths
4. Validate annotation persistence and retrieval
5. Test annotation interaction (selection, modification, deletion)
6. Verify annotation rendering on different viewport types

subtasks.title: Implement Annotation Manager
subtasks.description: Develop a central module to manage the lifecycle, state, and coordination of all annotations within the application.
subtasks.details: This includes creating data structures for storing annotations, methods for adding, updating, and removing annotations, and ensuring robust state management.

subtasks.title: Implement Text Annotation Tool
subtasks.description: Create a tool that allows users to add, edit, and position text annotations on the canvas or document.
subtasks.details: Integrate with the annotation manager to store and retrieve text annotation data, and provide a user interface for text input and placement.

subtasks.title: Implement Arrow Annotation Tool
subtasks.description: Develop a tool for users to draw and manipulate arrow annotations, supporting start/end points and directionality.
subtasks.details: Ensure arrow annotations are managed by the annotation manager and provide intuitive controls for drawing and adjusting arrows.

subtasks.title: Add Annotation Event Listeners
subtasks.description: Implement event listeners to handle user interactions such as creating, selecting, moving, and editing annotations.
subtasks.details: Event listeners should update the annotation manager state and trigger UI updates in response to user actions.

subtasks.title: Implement Annotation Styling Module
subtasks.description: Build a module to manage and apply styles (color, font, line width, etc.) to different annotation types.
subtasks.details: Allow users to customize annotation appearance and ensure consistent rendering across the application.

subtasks.title: Integrate Annotation Persistence
subtasks.description: Enable saving and loading of annotation data to and from persistent storage (e.g., database, local storage, or server).
subtasks.details: Ensure that all annotation types and their styles are correctly serialized and deserialized for reliable persistence.

subtasks.title: Test Annotation Interactions and Rendering
subtasks.description: Thoroughly test all annotation tools, event handling, styling, and persistence to ensure correct behavior and robust user experience.
subtasks.details: Include unit, integration, and user acceptance tests covering edge cases, concurrent edits, and data integrity.

tasks.title: Window/Level and Image Adjustment Implementation
tasks.description: Implement window/level (brightness/contrast) adjustment functionality with presets and interactive controls.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test window/level adjustments with mouse interactions
2. Verify preset functionality for different tissue types
3. Test manual window/level input controls
4. Validate window/level reset functionality
5. Test window/level adjustments on different image types
6. Verify window/level changes are correctly applied to the viewport

subtasks.title: Implement Window/Level Controller
subtasks.description: Develop the core logic to adjust window and level parameters for image brightness and contrast, ensuring real-time feedback and compatibility with various image types.
subtasks.details: This involves creating functions or classes that can modify the display range (window) and center (level) of image data, similar to how medical imaging tools adjust brightness and contrast. Ensure the controller can be called programmatically and supports synchronous interactive modification.

subtasks.title: Define and Manage Presets
subtasks.description: Establish a system to define, store, and retrieve window/level presets tailored for different diagnostic tasks or image types.
subtasks.details: Create a data structure or configuration file to hold preset values (e.g., for bone, soft tissue, lung). Implement functions to apply, add, edit, and remove presets, ensuring seamless integration with the window/level controller.

subtasks.title: Implement Window/Level Tool Integration
subtasks.description: Integrate the window/level controller with interactive tools, such as mouse or touch gestures, to allow users to adjust parameters dynamically.
subtasks.details: Map standard mouse or gesture controls to window and level adjustments, following conventions used in medical imaging software. Ensure changes are reflected in real time and are compatible with the controller logic.

subtasks.title: Create UI Panel for Adjustments
subtasks.description: Design and implement a user interface panel that allows users to manually adjust window and level values and select from available presets.
subtasks.details: The panel should include sliders or input fields for manual adjustment, a dropdown or list for presets, and real-time feedback of changes. Ensure accessibility and usability for clinical workflows.

subtasks.title: Integrate Manual and Preset Controls
subtasks.description: Coordinate manual adjustments and preset selection within the UI, ensuring consistent state management and user experience.
subtasks.details: Implement logic to handle transitions between manual changes and preset application, updating the display and internal state accordingly. Prevent conflicts and ensure intuitive behavior.

subtasks.title: Test Adjustments on Various Image Types
subtasks.description: Validate the window/level adjustment system across a range of image types (e.g., CT, MR, X-ray) and clinical scenarios.
subtasks.details: Perform functional and usability testing with different image datasets, verifying that both manual and preset controls produce optimal visual results and that the system responds correctly to user input.

tasks.title: Zoom, Pan and Navigation Tools Implementation
tasks.description: Implement image navigation tools including zoom, pan, and gesture support for both mouse and touch interactions.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test zoom functionality with mouse interactions and UI controls
2. Verify pan functionality with mouse drag operations
3. Test touch gestures on touch-enabled devices
4. Validate mouse wheel zoom functionality
5. Test zoom reset functionality
6. Verify zoom and pan operations work correctly on different viewport types

subtasks.title: Implement zoom tool
subtasks.description: Develop the core logic to allow users to zoom in and out of the visualization or content area, applying appropriate coordinate transformations for scaling.
subtasks.details: This involves handling scale changes, updating the view dynamically, and ensuring clarity at different zoom levels. Use libraries or custom code as appropriate for the project context.

subtasks.title: Implement pan tool
subtasks.description: Develop the logic to allow users to pan (move) the viewport horizontally and vertically within the content area.
subtasks.details: Implement translation transformations in response to user input, ensuring smooth and intuitive movement. Integrate with the zoom logic to maintain context.

subtasks.title: Create zoom controls UI
subtasks.description: Design and implement user interface controls for zooming, such as buttons or sliders, to provide accessible zoom options.
subtasks.details: Ensure the controls are responsive and update the view in real time. Controls should be accessible and visually integrated with the application.

subtasks.title: Add gesture handlers for touch
subtasks.description: Implement touch gesture recognition for zoom (pinch) and pan (drag) interactions on touch-enabled devices.
subtasks.details: Handle multi-touch events, ensuring gestures are smooth and do not conflict with other input modalities. Test for responsiveness and accuracy.

subtasks.title: Integrate mouse wheel and keyboard navigation
subtasks.description: Enable zoom and pan functionality using mouse wheel events and keyboard shortcuts for improved accessibility and usability.
subtasks.details: Map mouse wheel to zoom, arrow keys to pan, and provide keyboard shortcuts for zoom in/out. Ensure event handling does not interfere with other controls.

subtasks.title: Test navigation on multiple devices and viewport types
subtasks.description: Conduct comprehensive testing of zoom and pan features across various devices (desktop, tablet, mobile) and viewport sizes.
subtasks.details: Verify consistent behavior, performance, and responsiveness. Address any device-specific issues and ensure accessibility standards are met.

tasks.title: Image Rotation and Flip Implementation
tasks.description: Implement image orientation adjustment tools including rotation and flip functionality with UI controls.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test image rotation in both clockwise and counter-clockwise directions
2. Verify horizontal and vertical flip functionality
3. Test orientation reset functionality
4. Validate that orientation changes are correctly applied to the viewport
5. Test orientation controls UI interaction
6. Verify orientation adjustments work correctly on different image types

subtasks.title: Implement Rotation Controller
subtasks.description: Develop the core logic to rotate images by standard angles (e.g., 0, 90, 180, 270 degrees) and arbitrary angles, ensuring support for different image types.
subtasks.details: Use efficient algorithms or libraries (such as OpenCV or platform-specific APIs) to handle rotation. Ensure the controller can be invoked programmatically and maintains correct image orientation state.

subtasks.title: Implement Flip Controller
subtasks.description: Create functionality to flip images horizontally and vertically, updating the image state accordingly.
subtasks.details: Support both horizontal and vertical flips, possibly using transpose or mirror operations. Ensure compatibility with the rotation controller and correct state management.

subtasks.title: Create Orientation Controls UI
subtasks.description: Design and implement a user interface that allows users to rotate and flip images interactively.
subtasks.details: Provide buttons or controls for each orientation action (rotate left/right, flip horizontal/vertical, reset). Ensure the UI reflects the current orientation state and is accessible.

subtasks.title: Integrate with Viewport Rendering
subtasks.description: Connect the orientation controllers and UI to the image rendering pipeline so that changes are immediately visible in the viewport.
subtasks.details: Ensure that all orientation changes are rendered in real time and that the viewport updates correctly for all supported image types.

subtasks.title: Test Orientation Changes and Reset Functionality
subtasks.description: Verify that rotation, flipping, and reset actions work as expected across different image types and UI states.
subtasks.details: Develop and execute test cases for all orientation controls, including edge cases and state resets. Confirm correct state management and rendering after each operation.

tasks.title: Multi-Viewport System Implementation
tasks.description: Implement a flexible multi-viewport system with layout management and synchronization capabilities.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test creation of different viewport layouts (1x1, 2x2, 1x3, etc.)
2. Verify viewport synchronization for pan, zoom, and window/level
3. Test adding and removing viewports from sync groups
4. Validate that layout changes properly clean up and recreate viewports
5. Test viewport navigation across different viewport types
6. Verify that synchronization can be enabled/disabled as needed

subtasks.title: Implement viewport manager
subtasks.description: Develop a core module responsible for creating, tracking, and managing the lifecycle of individual viewports.
subtasks.details: This includes initializing viewport instances, maintaining a registry, and providing APIs for viewport access and manipulation.

subtasks.title: Implement layout manager
subtasks.description: Create a system to define, apply, and switch between different viewport layouts.
subtasks.details: The layout manager should support grid, row, column, and custom arrangements, and interact with the viewport manager to position viewports accordingly.

subtasks.title: Create dynamic viewport creation/removal
subtasks.description: Enable runtime addition and removal of viewports based on user actions or programmatic triggers.
subtasks.details: Ensure that the viewport manager and layout manager update their state and UI in response to these changes.

subtasks.title: Implement synchronization manager
subtasks.description: Develop a module to coordinate synchronization of state (e.g., pan, zoom, window-level) across multiple viewports.
subtasks.details: This manager should allow selective or global sync, and handle event propagation efficiently.

subtasks.title: Integrate pan/zoom/window-level sync
subtasks.description: Connect viewport interaction events (pan, zoom, window-level) to the synchronization manager for coordinated updates.
subtasks.details: Ensure that user actions in one viewport can update others according to the current sync configuration.

subtasks.title: Implement layout switching
subtasks.description: Allow users or the system to switch between different layouts dynamically, preserving viewport state where possible.
subtasks.details: Handle transitions smoothly, updating both the UI and internal state to reflect the new layout.

subtasks.title: Handle viewport cleanup
subtasks.description: Ensure proper cleanup and resource management when viewports are removed or layouts are switched.
subtasks.details: This includes detaching event listeners, freeing memory, and updating internal registries.

subtasks.title: Test with various layouts and sync scenarios
subtasks.description: Design and execute tests covering different layout configurations and synchronization cases.
subtasks.details: Include edge cases such as rapid layout switches, mass viewport creation/removal, and complex sync groupings.

subtasks.title: Document API for extensibility
subtasks.description: Produce comprehensive documentation for the viewport, layout, and synchronization APIs to support future extension and integration.
subtasks.details: Include usage examples, extension points, and guidelines for custom layout or sync strategies.

tasks.title: Series Navigation Implementation
tasks.description: Implement DICOM series navigation with stack tools, series browser, and thumbnail viewer functionality.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test series navigation with keyboard, mouse, and UI controls
2. Verify series browser displays correct series information
3. Test thumbnail viewer with different series sizes
4. Validate image selection and navigation within a series
5. Test stack navigation tool with mouse wheel and drag interactions
6. Verify correct image loading and display when navigating between series

subtasks.title: Implement Series Manager
subtasks.description: Develop a backend or data structure to manage collections of image series, including loading, storing, and retrieving series metadata and images.
subtasks.details: Ensure the manager can efficiently handle large datasets and supports operations like adding, removing, and querying series.

subtasks.title: Implement Stack Navigation Tool
subtasks.description: Create a navigation mechanism that allows users to move forward and backward through images within a series (stack navigation).
subtasks.details: Support keyboard, button, and possibly gesture-based navigation for smooth user experience.

subtasks.title: Create Series Browser UI
subtasks.description: Design and implement a user interface for browsing available series, displaying key metadata and allowing selection.
subtasks.details: Use visual cues and clear organization to help users quickly find and select series, even in large collections.

subtasks.title: Create Thumbnail Viewer UI
subtasks.description: Develop a UI component that displays thumbnails of images within the selected series for quick overview and navigation.
subtasks.details: Ensure thumbnails load efficiently and update responsively as users navigate or select different series.

subtasks.title: Integrate Navigation Controls
subtasks.description: Add and connect navigation controls (e.g., next/previous buttons, sliders) to the stack navigation and thumbnail viewer.
subtasks.details: Controls should be intuitive, responsive, and accessible, supporting both mouse and keyboard input.

subtasks.title: Handle Image/Series Selection Events
subtasks.description: Implement event handling logic for user actions such as selecting a series or an individual image, updating the UI and navigation state accordingly.
subtasks.details: Ensure that selection events trigger appropriate updates in both the main viewer and navigation controls.

subtasks.title: Test Navigation with Large and Multiple Series
subtasks.description: Conduct thorough testing of the navigation system using large datasets and multiple series to ensure performance, correctness, and smooth user experience.
subtasks.details: Identify and address any performance bottlenecks, UI glitches, or usability issues that arise with scale.
